text: Linwood E. Palmer Jr. (November 22, 1921 – July 24, 2008) was an American politician from Maine. A Republican from Nobleboro, he served six terms (12 years) in the Maine Legislature, including 10 in the Maine House of Representatives (1946–50 and 1972–78) and two in the Maine Senate (1951–52). During Palmer's last two terms in the Legislature (1974–78), he served as House Minority Leader. In 1978, Palmer won the Republican nomination for governor, but lost the general election to Democratic State Senator Joseph E. Brennan of Portland. Palmer attended Colby College, Andover Newton Theological School and the University of Maine. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2008 deaths Category:People from Nobleboro, Maine Category:Maine Republicans Category:Minority Leaders of the Maine House of Representatives Category:Maine state senators Category:Colby College alumni Category:Andover Newton Theological School alumni Category:University of Maine alumni Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Linwood E. Palmer Jr.
